lines.content: Welcome to **Zoro!** This tool is designed to help you manage your tasks efficiently, whether they are to-dos, deadlines, or events.
You can add three types of tasks:
Each task type helps you categorize your tasks for better organization.
Display all your tasks, including to-dos, deadlines, and events, along with their status
(completed or pending) and additional information like timeframe and deadline timing..
Mark any task as completed based on its list number to track your progress effectively.
Restore any completed task to pending status based on its list number. This feature helps you manage your tasks easily.
Remove tasks that are no longer needed or were added by mistake.
Search for tasks by keywords to quickly find specific tasks in your list. This feature helps you to find the task to know its deadline or timeframe along with its index to mark or unmark it.
All your tasks are automatically saved and loaded when you start the program again.
Make sure you have Java 11 or later installed on your computer.
1.Download the latest release of Zoro from the releases page.
2.Extract the downloaded zip file to a folder on your computer.
3.Navigate to the folder where you extracted the zip file and open a terminal.
4.Run the following command to start the Zoro application:
If the application started successfully, it will display the following welcome message.
What can I do for you?
Adds a simple task with no additional informatiom
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task to complete it by specific deadline
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with specific date and time.
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][ ] Build Core Muscles (from: Jan 01 2025 12:01 to: Jun 21 2025 11:59)
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Display all of your tasks, including To-dos, Deadlines and Events along with their status (completed or pending) and their deadline or timeframe.
Here are the tasks in your list:
3.[E][ ] Build Core Muscles (from: Jan 01 2025 12:01 to: Jun 21 2025 11:59)
Marks a specific Task as completed based on the list number provided.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### `unmark` - Mark Completed Task as not done
Unmarks a specific Task based on the list number provided. It helps to revert the task status to not completed.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a specific task from the list based on the list number provided.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Search for tasks using keywords to quickly find specific tasks in the filtered list.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
1[E][ ] Build Core Muscles (from: Jan 01 2025 12:01 to: Jun 21 2025 11:59). (Original Index: 2)
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* The InvalidDeadlineFormatException class represents an exception that is thrown
* when the deadline format provided by the user is invalid.
* Constructs a new InvalidDeadlineFormatException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The InvalidEventFormatException class represents an exception that is thrown
* when the event format provided by the user is invalid.
* Constructs a new InvalidEventFormatException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The InvalidTodoFormatException class represents an exception that is thrown
* when the todo format provided by the user is invalid.
* Constructs a new InvalidTodoFormatException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The LoadFileException class represents an exception that is thrown
* when there is an error loading a file.
* Constructs a new LoadFileException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.
* The SaveFileException class represents an exception that is thrown
* when there is an error saving a file.
* Constructs a new SaveFileException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the reason for the exception.

* It handles user input and invokes appropriate command objects based on the input.
* Constructs a CommandHandler object with the given TaskManager and UserInterface.
* @param taskManager   The TaskManager object to handle tasks.
* @param userInterface The UserInterface object to interact with the user.
* Handles the user command based on the input provided.

* Deletes a task specified by the user input.

* Marks a task as completed based on the user input.

* Marks a task as incomplete based on the user input.

* @param input The user input specifying the task to be unmarked.
* The Deadline class represents a task with a deadline.
* It inherits from the Task class and adds functionality specific to Deadline tasks.
* Constructs a Deadline object with the given description and deadline.
* @param by The deadline time for the task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline object.
* The representation includes the task type identifier, description, and deadline.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline object.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline object in a format suitable for file storage.
* The representation includes the task type identifier, status, description, and deadline.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline object for file storage.
* The Event class represents a task that occurs within a specific time frame.
* It inherits from the Task class and adds functionality specific to Event tasks.
* Constructs an Event object with the given description and time frame.
* @param from The starting time of the Event.
* @param to The ending time of the Event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event object.
* The representation includes the task type identifier, description, and timeframe.

* Returns a string representation of the Event object in a format suitable for file storage.
* The representation includes the task type identifier, status, description, and timeframe.
* @return A string representation of the Event object for file storage.

* It handles saved tasks and creates appropriate task objects based on the identifier.
* Handles the task stored in the file by parsing it and creating appropriate task objects.
* @return task The task being returned with appropriate details parsed from the file
* The Storage class handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Constructs a new Storage object with the given file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file storing tasks.
* Loads tasks from the file specified by the file path.
* @return An ArrayList containing the loaded tasks.
* @throws LoadFileException If an error occurs while loading tasks from the file.
throw new LoadFileException("Error loading tasks from file: " + e.getMessage());

* If the folder data doesn't exist it will create new folder at that location
* If the file tasks.txt doesn't exist it will create new file at in the data folder

public void saveTasksToFile(ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws SaveFileException {

* The Task class represents a task with a description and completion status.

* Subclasses should override this method to provide task-specific representation.
* @return A string representation of the task.

* It also calls functions from Storage class to handle loading tasks from
